content: opposite side of starting chain edging round 1 join mc in approximate center st of beg chain chain 1 single_crochet in same st single_crochet evenly around entire piece working 3 single_crochet in each corner join with slip_stitch to beg single_crochet fasten off do not turn round 2 join first contrast color in same st where last st was fastened off chain 1 single_crochet in ea st around working 3 single_crochet in each corner join with slip_stitch turn and fasten_off round 3 join second cc in same st where last st was fastened off chain 1 single_crochet in ea st around working 3 single_crochet in each corner join with slip_stitch turn and fasten_off round 4 buttonhole round join third cc in same st where last st was fastened off on this round make small buttonholes evenly around the entire edging every 6 to 8 sts being sure to place a buttonhole at each corner as follows 2 for buttonhole chain 2 skip 2 single_crochet *single_crochet in next 6 or 8 single_crochet chain 2 skip 2 single_crochet repeat from * around buttonholes are used later depending on how you decide to fasten the bunting but are small enough to not show if left unused join with slip_stitch to first single_crochet turn and fasten_off round 5 join fourth cc chain 1 single_crochet in ea single_crochet around placing 2 single_crochet in each buttonhole and working 3 single_crochet in each corner join with slip_stitch turn and fasten_off round 6 join fifth cc chain 1 single_crochet in ea single_crochet around working 3 single_crochet in each corner join with slip_stitch fasten_off finishing weave in all ends place bunting on table with shorter lengths at sides fold each side to the middle to form bunting decide how you want to close the front note make sure all ribbons ties or buttons are fastened securely lengths of ribbon or crocheted ties can be attached to buttonholes on both sides of front opening a longer length of ribbon or crocheted chain threaded through buttonholes at the lower edge form a drawstring to close it or sew on flat buttons to one side of front and lower openings ribbon could be threaded around the upper portion to form a hood or the top can be left open to form a collar and padding for baby s head if you want to use it as a blanket untie or unbutton all fastenings and lay it flat if you want to use it only as a bunting slip_stitch crochet fronts and back together across the bottom so it remains closed that s why it s named the changeable rainbow baby bunting copyright 2017 2003 kathy north -- www ravelry
